author: larry_vw_1955
content: Reps. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Adriano Espaillat spoke Friday morning to push for a pathway for migrants to more easily start working as one way to ease the social burden of the city’s influx of migrants.They were met with a loud crowd and were forced to shout.“They are prevented from getting jobs, they are prevented from employment and that is part of the strain on our public systems,” Ocasio-Cortez said over protestors. “So the faster that folks can access the work that they are asking for, legally, the better we can solve this problem.” why would you let people come into the country and not even let them work? it doesn't make sense. hopefully they are giving them some type of universal basic income while they sit and wait to work. that's all i can say!  there's too much red tape if someone is here in this country they shouldn't have to prove anything to anyone to be allowed to work. anyone agree?oh, i forgot the link to the story: https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/4206566-house-democrats-confronted-by-protestors-over-migrant-crisis-in-nyc/

The doctors and lawyers of NYC don't need to worry about this. The uber drivers do.In other words, if you're a skilled worker, it's within your interest to allow cheap unskilled labor to flourish. If you're an unskilled worker, it becomes an issue.Yes, the illegals could educate themselves and benefit the local economy. But that's not what happens in actuality. Illegals generally take up low skilled positions and stick to them.
